text: every day when my students come to
school and they come in my classroom I
thank them for getting there that day
because I know that they've run a
marathon sometimes they run over all
sorts of obstacles just to get to the
classroom door my name is Maggie
MacDonell and I teach in the Arctic as a
teacher in the Arctic the definition of
a teacher there is very very broad
you not only instruct lessons in the
classroom but you really have to engage
with your student outside of the
classroom you have to make the class and
school welcoming to them they have to
see you in the community often you take
on roles such as a social worker or a
counselor or maybe even a family friend
I think that of a student from the UK or
India were to drop into my classroom one
thing that they might be surprised about
is that not every classroom has four
walls and as much as possible I try to
take my students outside of the
traditional school and into the
community where we can do project-based
learning authentic learning and I think
that's what's really powerful about the
style of teaching that I've been working
on as much as possible I love
integrating my students into the
community creating opportunities for
them to offer community service and
basically create opportunities for my
students to see themselves not as
problems but but as agents of change in
their community
